item.description:
Explore Concord Center and Sleepy Hollow Cemeteries
When: Sunday Oct 14 10:30AM
Where: The Concord Visitor Center is located at 58 Main Street, Concord, MA 01742

ORGANIZER: Biagio (Note: there is a photo of me so you can find me)
CONTACT Biagio: http://socialnetwork....
TARGET AUDIENCE: All Members that like taking photos, graveyards, walks, leaves changing & the outdoors

Well its fall and it?s almost Halloween so let?s see if we can raise the dead! Ha!
I bumped into this place not far from Concord Center and figured it be fun to explore the area and take some photographs of the interesting Artwork on and around the graves there!
Link with photos etc: http://www.concordma....
Printable Map link: http://www.concordcha...

Let?s all meet at the The Concord Visitor Center is located at 58 Main Street, Concord, MA 01742. It?s at Concord Center off the rotary (RT 62) then move on to see some of the interesting old graves like: Hill Buying Grounds and Main Street Burying Grounds. Take some photos around the center too.

Then head over to Sleepy Hollow Cemeteries afterwards for the prize! It has an estimated 10,000 gravesites, many of local, national, and international interest. It was one of the first cemeteries in the United States to be designed to have a sylvan character and has also been listed in the National Register of Historic Places. To the right of the Melvin Memorial, up a short stretch of road lies a hollow, on the far side of which is Authors Ridge. Graves of Henry Thoreau (1862), Nathaniel Hawthorne (1864), Ralph Waldo Emerson (1882), Louisa May Alcott (1888) and her father, Bronson Alcott (1888). Each is buried in a family plot and marked with modest stones.

Even though it?s a photo shoot all are welcome to tag along for the walk and see the leaves change and enjoy the sites! I posted this on a few groups????.Note: Rain cancels this event! Enjoy!
item.name: Explore Concord Center and Sleepy Hollow Cemeteries
